page.title: 19LIFE IN UPHAM
page.content: People living in Upham and the surrounding countryside tend to think of it as a haven of peace and quiet. Some of them work in the nearby towns and cities, and so come home to "get away from it all"; others have retired to this small, caring community. Those who live and work on the farms strive to make a living from the land, in spite of the restrictions enforced at present by The European Economic Community on what may be produced. Beef and dairy cattle, sheep, pigs, horses and free-range poultry are all reared here. Barley, wheat, oats, hay, rape, flax and vegetables are all grown. The fields remain relatively small, the hedgerows survive to provide shelter for wildlife, and life goes on much as it always has done.
